1. Executive Summary
The music industry operates a broken value chain. Centralized streaming platforms use pro-rata payout models that incentivize bot farms and "AI slop" over genuine artistry. Independent artists face a "path to pennies"—investments of $100K+ into albums return as little as $1,200 in streaming royalties over 18 months. Identity verification failures enable fraud, while 30% platform taxes extract value from every transaction.
Sentio AI is a local-first generative audio ecosystem that structurally solves these problems. Rather than streaming audio files (50MB each), Sentio streams JSON instruction sets called VibeBlocks (<10KB)—a >1,000x reduction in data transfer. On-device AI models translate natural language and emotional intent into deterministic, royalty-free music compositions rendered locally from licensed sample libraries (CoreKits).
This architecture enables a 70/30 revenue split favoring creators, eliminates cloud compute costs, ensures complete user privacy (no prompts leave the device), and provides cryptographic proof of authorship ("Audit Insurance") that protects against copyright litigation—the existential threat that has crippled competitors like Udio.

2. Core Concepts: VibeBlocks, CoreKits & VibeBundles

2.1 VibeBlock (The Atomic Unit)

Key Properties: VibeBlocks are deterministic (same block + same CoreKit = identical audio), portable (works on any device with the referenced CoreKit), and ownable (cryptographic signature = unforgeable proof of authorship). They are the fundamental tradeable asset of the Vibe Economy.
2.2 CoreKit (The Sound Library)
A CoreKit is a curated, licensed sample library stored locally on the user’s device. It contains the actual audio assets (one-shots, loops, synth patches, vocals) that the VibeBlock’s instructions reference. CoreKits are the reason Sentio can guarantee a clean chain of title—every sound is either royalty-free, CC-licensed, or created by a verified artist.

3. User Personas

"I want to feel something, not fiddle with knobs."

Success metric: Daily active usage >15 min. Converts from free to sharing VibeBlocks with friends within 7 days.

"I need to own my sound and get paid fairly."

Demographics: 22–45, semi-pro to professional music producer. Uses Ableton/Logic/FL Studio daily. Familiar with Splice, MIDI, audio processing. Owns mid-to-high-end hardware (M-series Mac or RTX GPU).

3.4 The Fan
"I want to collect, remix, and share my favorite artists’ vibes."
Demographics: 14–30, active on social media, collects digital goods (NFTs, skins, merch). Values exclusivity and community. Attends live events.

Success metric: Purchases >3 marketplace items/month. Creates >5 remixes/month. Drives organic referrals through social sharing.

4. Technical Architecture
4.1 Architecture Principles
Local-First: All AI inference, audio rendering, and asset storage happen on-device. The cloud is only used for marketplace indexing and payment processing.
Privacy-by-Default: No user prompts, creative data, or listening habits are transmitted to servers. Analytics are opt-in and anonymized.
Asset Sovereignty: Users own their VibeBlocks, CoreKits, and VibeBundles. Canceling a subscription does not revoke access to purchased or created assets.
Deterministic Rendering: Same VibeBlock + same CoreKit = identical audio output on any device. No cloud-side randomness.
GPL-Free Stack: All dependencies are MIT, Apache 2.0, or commercially licensed. No GPL contamination to protect commercial sovereignty.

5. Feature Specifications
5A. Sentio Mobile (The Performer)
The mobile app is the primary entry point for Explorers and Fans. It prioritizes instant gratification, emotional expression, and social sharing. The Qwen3 0.6B model enables real-time VibeBlock generation from natural language prompts with <200ms AI response time.
Core Mobile Flows
Quick Vibe: User types or speaks a mood ("rainy Sunday morning"). AI generates a VibeBlock. Audio renders locally in <2 seconds. User can save, share, or tweak.
Browse & Buy: Marketplace tab with curated collections, trending blocks, artist spotlights. One-tap purchase ($0.49–$2.99). Instant download (<10KB).
Remix: Purchased VibeBlocks can be modified: change BPM, key, instruments, FX. Modified version is a new VibeBlock with parent_id linking to original for royalty attribution.
Vibe Match (Listen Mode): Hold phone near external audio source. Meyda.js analyzes tempo, key, energy. AI generates a similar VibeBlock using local CoreKit. Intentionally "lossy"—captures vibe, not exact copy.

5B. Sentio Studio Desktop (The Composer)
The desktop application targets Producers and professional Artists. Built on Tauri 2.0 with Rust audio backend, it provides the computational headroom for complex music theory reasoning, LoRA fine-tuning, and DAW integration.
Desktop-Exclusive Features
Multi-Model Workflow: Quick draft with Qwen3 0.6B, then refine with ChatMusician 7B for music theory accuracy, then polish with Qwen 2.5 14B/32B for complex arrangements. Models hot-swappable.
Ghost Producer Pipeline: Drag audio folder → automatic LoRA fine-tuning on user’s style (30–60 min on RTX 3090) → AI generates new compositions in user’s signature sound. V1 feature.
VST3/AU Sidecar: Sentio runs as out-of-process companion to DAWs. JUCE-based bridge communicates via lock-free ring buffers. MIDI input triggers AI generation; output routes back as audio/MIDI.
Intelligent Stems: Import audio → HT-Demucs separates into stems → Basic Pitch converts melody to MIDI → AI uses extracted groove/melody as seed for new VibeBlock generation.
Neural Timbre Transfer: RAVE/BRAVE integration: beatbox into mic → real-time transformation to saxophone, cello, or any trained timbre. Sub-10ms latency with BRAVE architecture.
Advanced Composition UI: Timeline view for VibeBundles, multi-track editing, automation curves, per-track CoreKit assignment, export to MIDI/WAV/STEM.

5C. Vibe Marketplace
The marketplace is the economic engine of the Sentio ecosystem. It is a hybrid cloud platform: the instrument is 100% local, but discovery and commerce require a central index. Because assets are JSON text (<10KB), not audio files (50MB), cloud infrastructure costs are ~99% lower than Spotify/Splice.
Marketplace Architecture
Local-First, Cloud-Sync: Users create VibeBlocks locally. When they tap "Publish to Market", WatermelonDB syncs the JSON to Supabase. The server verifies: (1) user’s Ed25519 signature is valid, (2) referenced CoreKit exists and is licensed, (3) listing fee is paid. Block appears in global search.

Anti-Piracy: The Poisoned Preview
When a VibeBlock is listed, the server renders a 30-second audio preview embedded with an AudioSeal watermark at -15dB. The actual JSON source is encrypted and only decrypted upon purchase. This means:
Humans can judge the vibe from the preview and decide to buy.
AI (Vibe Match) gets corrupted analysis from the watermark—generating garbage approximations, not accurate copies.
The $0.99 Rule: History (Steam, iTunes) proves people pay for convenience. One-tap buy beats the 10-step piracy workaround every time.
Royalty Attribution Chain
When a remixed VibeBlock is sold, the system traces the parent_id chain and automatically splits revenue. Example: Artist A creates Block X. Fan B remixes it into Block Y. Producer C remixes Block Y into Block Z. When Block Z sells for $2.99: Producer C gets $1.05 (50%), Artist A gets $0.30 (originator bonus), Fan B gets $0.30 (remix chain), Sentio gets $0.90 (30%). Maximum chain depth: 5 levels. Beyond that, deeper ancestors split the originator bonus proportionally.
Cold Start: Founder’s Packs
To solve the empty marketplace problem at launch, Sentio commissions 10–20 professional sound designers to create high-quality "Founder’s Packs"—curated CoreKits and VibeBundles across key genres (Lo-Fi, EDM, Hip-Hop, Ambient, Jazz). These are featured prominently and serve as templates for how artists should package their own offerings.

5D. Live Radio
Live Radio transforms Sentio from a creation tool into an infinite, personalized listening experience. Unlike Spotify’s static playlists or YouTube Music’s AI-curated stations (which still play pre-recorded tracks), Sentio’s Radio generates music in real-time on-device. Every listening session is unique. The music literally never existed before and will never exist again.
How It Works
Station Selection: User selects a mood/genre station ("Lo-Fi Study", "Deep House Workout", "Ambient Sleep") or describes one in natural language ("something for a rainy drive through the mountains").
Continuous Generation: The AI generates VibeBlocks in a pipeline—while Block N is playing, Block N+1 is being generated, and Block N+2 is in the inference queue. This ensures gapless playback.
Intelligent Transitions: Each new block is constrained by GBNF grammar rules that enforce musical coherence with the previous block: compatible key (same key, relative major/minor, or smooth modulation), tempo within ±5 BPM (or gradual drift), and energy level following a macro "arc" (build→peak→cooldown→build).
Crossfade Rendering: Signalsmith Stretch handles seamless crossfading between blocks (2–4 second transitions). Audio engine pre-buffers 10–15 seconds ahead.
User Interaction: Listeners can nudge the station in real-time: "more energy", "add piano", "darker". These modify the generation constraints for subsequent blocks without interrupting current playback.

5E. Campfire Mode
Campfire Mode is Sentio’s peer-to-peer, offline-first collaborative music creation and distribution feature. It restores the intimate, direct artist-to-fan connection that streaming destroyed—using local mesh networking to beam VibeBlocks between devices without touching the internet.
Three Campfire Scenarios
Scenario 1: Artist Drop (Distribution)
An artist at a live venue activates Campfire broadcast mode. Their phone becomes a beacon, offering exclusive VibeBlocks to nearby devices. Fans within Bluetooth/WiFi Direct range (~30–100 feet) receive the drop directly. Each drop is signed with the artist’s Ed25519 key, creating a verifiable "Proof of Attendance" (POAP). These exclusive blocks are marked as Campfire Originals in the fan’s library—collectible, tradeable on marketplace later with provenance proof.
Scenario 2: Collaborative Jam (Creation)
2–8 users in the same physical space start a Campfire Jam session. One device acts as the "Host" (sets BPM, key, CoreKit). Each participant contributes VibeBlocks to a shared VibeBundles that plays on all devices simultaneously. CRDT-based sync (Automerge) ensures conflict-free merging even with dropped connections. The resulting collaborative VibeBundles lists all contributors and auto-splits any future marketplace revenue.
Scenario 3: Fan Seeding (P2P Distribution)
Popular VibeBlocks and CoreKits can be "seeded" by fans who already own them, similar to BitTorrent. When a new user wants to download a popular block, instead of pulling from the central server, nearby Campfire-enabled devices can serve it. This creates a decentralized CDN that scales with popularity—the more popular a block, the more seeders, the faster the download. Seeders earn micro-credits toward marketplace purchases.

5F. Ghost Producer (Style Transfer)
Ghost Producer is the desktop-only feature that converts Sentio from a generic instrument into your personal instrument. It uses LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation) fine-tuning to teach the AI model a specific artist’s creative signature—their rhythmic swing, harmonic preferences, arrangement patterns, and sonic palette.
Pipeline
Ingest: User drags a folder of their audio files (stems, bounces, projects) into Sentio Studio.
Analyze: HT-Demucs separates stems. Basic Pitch extracts MIDI. Feature analysis captures: BPM distributions, key preferences, chord progression patterns, rhythmic swing values, arrangement structures, FX chain signatures.
Train: Unsloth + QLoRA fine-tunes a LoRA adapter on the extracted patterns. 7B model: 30–60 min on RTX 3090 (24GB VRAM, 6–8GB with QLoRA). Rank 8–16, learning rate 2e-4, 1–3 epochs.
Generate: User prompts AI as normal, but with LoRA adapter loaded. Output VibeBlocks reflect the user’s personal style signature.
Package (Optional): Artist can package their LoRA adapter as a "Ghost Producer Kit" for marketplace sale. Fans buy it to generate unlimited compositions in that artist’s style.

## 1. Problem Statement
The music industry operates a broken value chain where centralized streaming platforms use pro-rata payout models that incentivize bot farms and "AI slop" over genuine artistry. Independent artists face a "path to pennies"—investments of $100K+ into albums return as little as $1,200 in streaming royalties over 18 months (~$0.003/stream). Identity verification failures enable fraud, 30% platform taxes extract value from every transaction, and cloud-based AI music tools expose creators to copyright litigation risk and computational costs that don't scale.

## 2. Target Users

- **The Explorer** (16-35): Casual music consumer, no musical training, discovers through social media, wants to feel something without fiddling with knobs
- **The Artist** (20-40): Independent musician/producer frustrated by streaming payouts, needs to own their sound and get paid fairly, has 1K-100K followers
- **The Producer** (22-45): Semi-pro to professional, uses DAWs daily, needs precision tools that integrate with existing workflow
- **The Fan** (14-30): Collects digital goods, values exclusivity and community, wants to collect, remix, and share favorite artists' vibes

## 3. Proposed Solution

A **local-first generative audio ecosystem** that fundamentally restructures music distribution by streaming JSON instruction sets (VibeBlocks, <10KB) instead of audio files (50MB)—a >1,000x data reduction. On-device AI models translate natural language and emotional intent into deterministic, royalty-free music compositions rendered locally from licensed sample libraries (CoreKits). This architecture eliminates cloud compute costs, ensures complete user privacy (no prompts leave the device), and provides cryptographic proof of authorship via Ed25519 signatures.

**Core mechanism**: User prompts "rainy Sunday morning" → Qwen3 0.6B generates VibeBlock JSON → local audio engine renders music from CoreKit samples → result is ownable, remixable, and tradeable.

## 4. Key Features

- **VibeBlocks**: JSON instruction sets (<10KB) that define complete musical ideas—the atomic tradeable unit
- **CoreKits**: Curated, licensed sample libraries stored locally (Foundation/Genre/Artist/Ghost Producer variants)
- **Sentio Mobile** (The Performer): Natural language music generation, marketplace browsing, remix tools, Live Radio
- **Sentio Studio Desktop** (The Composer): Multi-model workflows, Ghost Producer style transfer via LoRA, VST3/AU DAW integration, stem separation
- **Vibe Marketplace**: Creator-first economy with 70/30 revenue split, royalty attribution chains for remixes, anti-piracy via "poisoned previews"
- **Live Radio**: Infinite generative streaming with real-time style nudging, entirely on-device
- **Campfire Mode**: P2P mesh networking for offline artist drops, collaborative jams, and fan-driven distribution
- **Ghost Producer**: LoRA fine-tuning to capture a user's creative signature and generate in their style

## 5. Differentiation

Sentio is the **only platform combining**:
- **On-device AI generation** (privacy + zero cloud compute cost)
- **Structured JSON asset format** (enables remixing, trading, near-zero hosting costs)
- **Creator-first marketplace** (70/30 split vs. industry standard ~50% or streaming's <1%)
